courseName: MTHED 305: Elementary Mathematics Content and Pedagogy
courseDescription: Designed to help develop deeper understanding of important elementary mathematics concepts and improve ability to reason mathematically, communicate mathematical ideas, and solve mathematics problems. Engage in mathematical exploration related to topics likely to teach in elementary school, communicate thinking orally and in writing, examine how children think and learn, and consider teaching practices promoting learning with understanding.

exams.description: Two take-home midterm exams and cumulative take-home final

midterms.revision: Test revision option available for students earning A- or lower on either midterm

homeworkAndReadings.readings: Children's Mathematics and occasional additional readings posted to Learning Suite

homeworkAndReadings.work: Class discussions and periodic assignments included in homework grade

analysesOfChildrensThinking.opportunities: Three points during semester including two in-person interviews and one classroom observation
components: Written analysis according to principles learned in class
